briefdescription.para: Delay before held keys begin to auto-repeat.
Interval between auto-repeats once a key is held down.
Size of the circular keyboard buffer in bytes.

detaileddescription.para: All translated keypresses are queued here. When the buffer fills, new input will overwrite oldest unread characters.
These are returned by kgetc() when pressed. BASIC exposes them directly via INKEY$.
Claims IRQ1, sets up the scan code map, and clears the keyboard buffer ready for use.

briefdescription.para: Reads the next key from the keyboard buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Current console (unused, reserved for future use).

simplesect.para: ASCII character or extended key constant, or 255 if no input is available.

briefdescription.para: Checks the next key in the keyboard buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Current console (unused, reserved for future use).

simplesect.para: ASCII character or extended key constant, or 255 if no input is available.

briefdescription.para: Tests if the CTRL key is currently held down.

simplesect.para: true if CTRL is held, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Tests if the SHIFT key is currently held down.

simplesect.para: true if SHIFT is held, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Tests if the ALT key is currently held down.

simplesect.para: true if ALT is held, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Tests if CAPS LOCK is currently engaged.

simplesect.para: true if CAPS LOCK is on, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Load a keymap from a null-terminated text string.

detaileddescription.para: Format: &1E a A # scancode &1E produces 'a' and 'A' &02 1 ! # scancode &02 produces '1' and '!' &1C &0D # scancode &1C is Enter (hex 0D)

listitem.para: First field must be scancode prefixed with & (hexadecimal).
Two tokens may follow: normal (unshifted) and shifted.
If only one token is given, shifted = normal.

briefdescription.para: Low-level keyboard input driver for Retro Rocket.

detaileddescription.para:
Craig Edwards
Copyright (c) 2012-2025
This module handles:
PS/2 scan code to ASCII translation (UK layout by default).
Modifier key state tracking (Shift, Ctrl, Alt, Caps Lock).
Buffered keypress input for use by the console/OS.
Extended keycodes for non-ASCII keys (arrows, paging, etc).
Key repeat timing control.
BASIC programs see input via INKEY$, which may return ASCII characters or extended key constants defined here.
